job.name: Leather Patched Hats
job.note:
Recommended heat press settings, requires bottom heat press. Time and temperatures may vary. Testing application is recommended. Samples are available.
Not for extended use in areas over 110°F (44°C).
Printer Friendly Version

Top and Bottom Heat

TEMPERATURE:

330° F

TIME:

25-30 Seconds

PRESSURE:

Medium/Heavy

COVER SHEET:

1/8" Silicone Pad

Note: Pre-heat garments for 2-3 seconds. Cotton garments may require up to 8 sec pre-heat.

Soft Rubber requires bottom heat for heat seal application.

FOR USE ON:

Cotton, Cotton/Poly Blends, 100% Polyester, Fleece and Wool

DOES NOT WORK ON:

Leather, Nylon, some types of Coatings on Athletic Mesh and Safety Gear

Common Troubleshooting Instructions

Problem:
The patch isn’t sticking.
1.) Try letting it cool a bit more. If the patch is still hot when you’re testing adhesion, it could come of before it has time to cool enough to hold tight. Please wait at least 10 minutes for the patch to cool. This allows it to set before you test adhesion.
2.) Check your heat and pressure settings. Are they in line with the recommended temperatures for the fabric type you’re using? Some sporty polyesters, such as baseball uniforms, have a very high temperature setting needed to get the heat seal to properly adhere.
3.) Pro tip: Try preheating your fabric for a few seconds before adding the patch. Sometimes, this can make all the difference in the world.
Problem:
The patch/fabric is discoloring and burning.
1.) Use a back heat press. We always recommend using a back heat press, where the heat is only on the bottom and behind the patch. That way, it's closer to the heat seal, and won't hurt your emblem.
2.) Check your cover sheet! Barriers such as teflon or silicon can make a big difference. Have you tried using a silicon pad between the heat source and your patch? This can protect from burning.
3.) Experiment with application times. You could be keeping a patch under a press for too long. Try reducing the time and see how the application fares. Please reach out if you need similar product samples, we’d be happy to send you some for free that you could test to get th

settings.order_term_text:
Payment terms for your order are listed at the top right of your invoice.
Deposit terms we use based on items being ordered are 50%, 60%, 70%
 Deposit  is required at the time of art and quote approval, unless your company has different terms already agreed upon with management.

If you purchase patches for headwear and take advantage of ordering higher quantities for price breaks those purchased patches must be used on product provided by Hub City Design Inc. Patches are considered property of Hub City Design until applied to finished goods and cannot be received later as individual items. 

If you're providing us with items for decoration or customization please note human or machine errors happen in this field of business. We do everything we can to assure there is no waste and your order turns out as expected in full. We cannot be held liable for these products, please reach out and speak to us prior to supplying goods of your own.

If paying with Cash/Check/Bank Transfer there is 3% discount, please notify us prior to making any payments to have this reflected on your total balance! You will see a line item as "Credit Card Processing" if this fee is active on your order. If we are already aware of your payment method not being by card this will not be listed on your invoice and no further discount is needed.

settings.job_approval_term_text:
Artwork Approval Terms

  • Proof Review & Signoff
    Before we print, you'll receive a digital proof. Please check spelling, layout, color, and design carefully and approve it in writing—via email or online form—before we proceed.

  • Revision Policy
    We offer two rounds of revisions at no extra cost. Any additional edits or changes requested after final proof approval may result in extra charges or delays.

  • Color Accuracy & Design Adjustments
    We aim to match colors accurately, but slight differences can occur due to screen display or printing processes. Precise Pantone matching is available for a fee. We may also make minor adjustments for print quality or production constraints—major changes will be communicated to you for approval.

  • Timelines & Liability
    Timely feedback helps ensure production and delivery stay on schedule. Once you approve the proof, you're confirming that everything is correct—and any errors in the approved proof become your responsibility.

  • Cancellations & Refunds
    Once production begins, cancellations or refunds aren’t available. If you cancel before approval, design or material costs may be deducted from your refund.

  • If you purchase patches for headwear and take advantage of ordering higher quantities for price breaks those purchased patches must be used on product provided by Hub City Design Inc. Patches are considered property of Hub City Design until applied to finished goods and cannot be received later as individual items.

  • Confidentiality
    Your artwork and related designs are confidential and will only be used to fulfill your order.

settings.order_approval_term_text:
• Order Approval by Payment: Making any payment means you approve the order details as quoted (items, quantities, and pricing). No order will proceed without payment or written approval.
  • Separate Artwork Approval Required: Artwork proofs must always be approved in writing, even if payment has been made. Production will not begin until artwork is approved.
  • Changes & Additional Costs: Changes to orders or artwork after approval may result in extra charges and impact delivery time. All changes must be confirmed in writing.
  • Timelines & Delivery: Production and delivery dates are based on prompt payment and approvals. Delays in approval or payment may delay your order.
  • Cancellations & Refunds: No cancellations or refunds once production or ordering has started. If canceled before production, non-recoverable costs may be deducted from any refund.
  •            Client Responsibility:            You are responsible for reviewing and confirming all order and artwork details. Hub City Design Inc. is not liable for errors present in approved proofs or orders.
  • If you purchase patches for headwear and take advantage of ordering higher quantities for price breaks those purchased patches must be used on product provided by Hub City Design Inc. Patches are considered property of Hub City Design until applied to finished goods and cannot be received later as individual items.
           
By making payment or providing written approval, you agree to these terms.

If paying with Cash/Check/Bank Transfer, a 3% discount applies. Please notify us prior to payment to have this reflected on your total balance! You will see a line item as "Credit Card Processing" if this fee is active on your order. If we already know your payment method is not by card, this will not be listed on your invoice and no further discount is needed.
